basics.name: Thibault Barillon
basics.label: Senior Product Manager
basics.summary: A technically-minded Senior Product Manager passionate about delivering products that bring meaningful value to customers and the broader market. I run on curiosity, empathy and pragmatism to enable customers to successfully deliver their outcomes of today and tomorrow. My interests range from neuroscience, engineering and cybersecurity to art and music (you may already know me as 1/6th of Robocobra Quartet).

work.position: Senior Product Manager for SaaS Customer Success
work.summary: Senior Product Manager focusing on portfolio Transformation to SaaS, with a keen focus on Customer Success and weaving in Gen AI to augment Security Operations. I am currently building and leading a program to understand customer success for IBM Security SaaS offerings, and embed a SaaS First mindset, behaviours and activities in all groups involved throughout the SaaS customer journey.
Senior Product Manager at IBM Security for Threat Detection & Response, specialising in SIEM and XDR. I've been principally focused on Product Lifecycle, Strategy and Portfolio Transformation.
Product Manager for QRadar SIEM, working with multiple distributed teams to bring to market innovations that deliver on customer outcomes.

Development Lead and Product Owner for IBM QRadar Vulnerability Manager. I focused on leading the team, prioritising features with all stakeholders and advocating for customers. I also prepared architectural options for vetting by the architecture team. High focus on scalability, quality and accuracy, and alternative feature delivery methods to enable continuous delivery outside of platform release cycle. Stack: Java, PostgreSQL, Perl, Docker, Python, bash, RHEL.

Software Engineer and then Senior Software Engineer on the QRadar Platform. Working on high performance and scalability vulnerability assessment and SIEM for the QRadar platform, as well as building the first version of the App framework for the QRadar platform and designing and building the first developer SDK, for which I received an IBM Outstanding Technical Achievement Award. Stack: Python, Docker, PostgreSQL, RHEL, Java, Perl

Intern at iOS apps incubator Edenpod in Singapore, working on multiple iOS apps and games. One of them led to spin-off TradeHero, of which I became the second Software Engineer and worked on both iOS client development and building our first server infrasructure using a .NET stack, and building our Continuous Integration pipeline for both front-end and back-end using Jenkins.
